program description: The KHCC Teen Center serves youth ages 11 to 21 years in grades 6-12, and often into young adulthood and college. During the previous program year, the Teen Center enrolled 257 youth, 49% female and 51% male. There were 54 middle school students (21%) ranging in age from 11-14, 191 high school students (74%) ranging in age from 14-21, and 12 youth participants who were 19-21 years old (5%), and either out of school, recently graduated, or attending college. Eighty-three percent of our active youth (213 participants) reported as eligible for free or reduced price lunch at school. The vast majority of program participants are living below 125% of the poverty level where low-wage jobs support the household. A significant proportion of our participants grow up in Bronx homes with multiple families living together in compromised housing situations. School failure, violence, substance abuse, gang involvement, and self-destructive behaviors are common experiences among neighborhood youth. Some participants are special needs youth who exhibit behavioral disorders and learning disabilities. Many youth are linked to neglectful family environments and interact with the justice and/or social service systems.
